content: change to rc at the end of your last scblo drop mc towards the ws - do not cut mc *ch1 sk1 single_crochet* repeat * to * 21 times work your last single_crochet in the chain space before the ch2 turning chain of the previous row ch2 turn row 4 ws continue in rc single_crochet into first ch1 space *ch1 sk1 single_crochet* 62 sts repeat * to * 20 times change to mc at the end of your last single_crochet in rc work # 19sc blo work last single_crochet into both of the top 2 loops cut rc leave a decent length tail to work over in the next row ch1 turn row 5 rs continue in mc single_crochet into the top 2 loops of the first st 19sc 62 sts blo # *ch1 sk1 single_crochet* repeat * to * 21 times work over rc yarn tail in this row work your last single_crochet in the chain space before the ch2 turning chain of the previous row ch2 turn row 6 ws continue in mc single_crochet into first ch1 space *ch1 sk1 single_crochet* repeat * 62 sts to * 20 times this ends just before the sm work # 19sc blo and in the last st work single_crochet through both top loops ch1 turn row 7 11 15 19 23 27 31 35 39 43 47 51 55 59 63 67 71 rs repeat row 3 62 sts 75 79 83 87 91 95 99 103 107 111 row 8 12 16 20 24 28 32 36 40 44 48 52 56 60 64 ws repeat row 4 62 sts 68 72 76 80 84 88 92 96 100 104 108 112* row 9 13 17 21 25 29 33 37 41 45 49 53 57 61 65 69 73 rs repeat row 5 62 sts 77 81 85 89 93 97 101 105 109 row 10 14 18 22 26 30 34 38 42 46 50 54 58 62 66 ws repeat row 6 62 sts 70 74 78 82 86 90 94 98 102 106 110 * last row row 112 ~ move onto the joining the beanie section for all sizes 9 the sassy scrappy beanie by off the hook creative ©2025 joining the beanie for all sizes fold the beanie in half with the right sides facing towards each other so the wrong side is on the outside making a tube try to line the stitches on each short end as evenly as possible before you start to join starting from where you left off at the end of your last row slip_stitch join to the first chain from row 1 to the front loop of the last continue to slip_stitch join the brim and head section the same way ensuring that you are evenly joining the same stitch from both ends of the work continue joining up to the top of the beanie place a sm in your working loop so you don t lose
